<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(i)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; nonrecurring
reasonable costs and expenses incurred in connection with any proposed
acquisition that is not closed or closed Permitted Acquisition;</font></p>

<p style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:10.0pt;margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;"><i><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;font-style:italic;">provided</font></i> that any amount deducted
pursuant of any of the foregoing clauses that will be paid after the close of
such Excess Cash Flow Period shall not be deducted again in a subsequent Excess
Cash Flow Period; <i>plus</i>, without duplication:</p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(i)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; the
difference, if positive, of the amount of Net Working Capital at the end of the
prior Excess Cash Flow Period over the amount of Net Working Capital at the end
of such Excess Cash Flow Period;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(ii)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; all
proceeds received during such Excess Cash Flow Period of any Indebtedness to
the extent used to finance any Capital Expenditure (other than Indebtedness
under this</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">15</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='15',FILE='C:\fc\7303751694_H10359_1860114\5447-2-ko-07.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 14 00:37 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">Agreement to the extent
there is no corresponding deduction to Excess Cash Flow above in respect of the
use of such borrowings);</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(iii)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; to the extent any permitted Capital
Expenditures referred to in clause (d) above do not occur in the Excess Cash
Flow Period specified in the certificate of Borrower provided pursuant to
clause (d) above, such amounts of Capital Expenditures that were not so made in
the Excess Cash Flow Period specified in such certificates;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(iv)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; any return on or in respect of
investments received in cash during such period, which investments were made
pursuant to <u>Section&nbsp;6.04(e)</u> or <u>Section 6.07(f)</u>; and</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:avoid;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(v)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;  income
or gain excluded from the calculation of Consolidated Net Income by operation
of clause&nbsp;(c) or (h) of the definition thereof that is realized in cash
during such Excess Cash Flow Period (except to the extent such gain is subject
to <u>Section&nbsp;2.10(c)</u> or <u>(d)</u>).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Excess Cash Flow Period</b>&#148;
shall mean each fiscal year of Borrower, commencing with the fiscal year ending
December&nbsp;31, 2007.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Exchange Act</b>&#148;
shall mean the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Excluded Taxes</b>&#148;
shall mean, with respect to the Administrative Agent, any Lender, the Issuing
Bank or any other recipient of any payment to be made by or on account of any
obligation of Borrower hereunder, (a)&nbsp;taxes imposed on or measured by its
overall net income (however denominated), franchise taxes imposed on it (in
lieu of net income taxes) and branch profits taxes imposed on it, by a
jurisdiction (or any political subdivision thereof) as a result of the
recipient being organized or having its principal office or, in the case of any
Lender, its applicable lending office in such jurisdiction and (b) in the case
of a Foreign Lender, any U.S. federal withholding tax that (i) is imposed on
amounts payable to such Foreign Lender at the time such Foreign Lender becomes
a party hereto (or designates a new lending office), except (x) to the extent
that such Foreign Lender (or its assignor, if any) was entitled, at the time of
designation of a new lending office (or assignment), to receive additional
amounts from Borrower with respect to such withholding tax pursuant to <u>Section
2.15(a)</u> or (y) if such Foreign Lender is an assignee pursuant to a request
by Borrower under <u>Section 2.16</u>; <i>provided
</i>that this subclause (b)(i) shall not apply to any Tax imposed on a
Lender in connection with an interest or participation in any Loan or other obligation
that such Lender was required to acquire pursuant to <u>Section 2.14(d)</u>, or
(ii)&nbsp;is attributable to such Foreign Lender&#146;s failure to comply with <u>Section
2.15(e)</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Executive Order</b>&#148; shall have the meaning assigned to such
term in <u>Section&nbsp;3.22</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Existing Letters of Credit</b>&#148;
means the letters of credit outstanding on the Closing Date and set forth on <u>Schedule
1.01(c)</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Existing Lien</b>&#148;
shall have the meaning assigned to such term in <u>Section&nbsp;6.02(c)</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Federal Funds Effective
Rate</b>&#148; shall mean, for any day, the weighted average of the rates on
overnight federal funds transactions with members of the Federal Reserve System
of the United States arranged by federal funds brokers, as published on the
next succeeding Business Day by the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, or, if
such rate is not so published for any day that is a Business Day, the average
of the quotations for the day for such transactions received by the
Administrative Agent from three federal funds brokers of recognized standing
selected by it.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">16</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='16',FILE='C:\fc\7303751694_H10359_1860114\5447-2-ko-07.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 14 00:37 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Fees</b>&#148; shall
mean the Commitment Fees, the Administrative Agent Fees, the LC Participation
Fees and the Fronting Fees.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Final Maturity Date</b>&#148;
shall mean the latest of the Revolving Maturity Date, the Term Loan Maturity
Date and any Incremental Term Loan Maturity Date applicable to existing
Incremental Term Loans, as of any date of determination.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Financial Officer</b>&#148;
of any person shall mean the chief financial officer, principal accounting officer,
treasurer or controller of such person.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>FIRREA</b>&#148; shall
mean the Financial Institutions Reform, Recovery and Enforcement Act of 1989,
as amended.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Foreign Lender</b>&#148;
shall mean any Lender that is not, for United States federal income tax
purposes, (i)&nbsp;an individual who is a citizen or resident of the United
States, (ii)&nbsp;a corporation, partnership or other entity treated as a
corporation or partnership created or organized in or under the laws of the
United States, or any political subdivision thereof, (iii)&nbsp;an estate whose
income is subject to U.S. federal income taxation regardless of its source or
(iv)&nbsp;a trust if a court within the United States is able to exercise
primary supervision over the administration of such trust and one or more
United States persons have the authority to control all substantial decisions
of such trust.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Foreign Subsidiary</b>&#148;
shall mean a Subsidiary that is organized under the laws of a jurisdiction
other than the United States or any state thereof or the District of Columbia.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Fronting Fee</b>&#148;
shall have the meaning assigned to such term in <u>Section&nbsp;2.05(c)</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Fund</b>&#148; shall
mean any person that is (or will be) engaged in making, purchasing, holding or
otherwise investing in commercial loans and similar extensions of credit in the
ordinary course of its business.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>GAAP</b>&#148; shall
mean generally accepted accounting principles in the United States applied on a
consistent basis.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Governmental Authority</b>&#148;
shall mean the government of the United States or any other nation, or of any
political subdivision thereof, whether state, provincial or local, and any
agency, authority, instrumentality, regulatory body, court, central bank or
other entity exercising executive, legislative, judicial, taxing, regulatory or
administrative powers or functions of or pertaining to government (including
any supra-national bodies such as the European Union or the European Central
Bank).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Governmental Real Property
Disclosure Requirements</b>&#148; shall mean any Requirement of Law of any
Governmental Authority requiring notification of the buyer, lessee, mortgagee,
assignee or other transferee of any Real Property, facility, establishment or
business, or notification, registration or filing to or with any Governmental
Authority, in connection with the sale, lease, mortgage, assignment or other
transfer (including any transfer of control) of any Real Property, facility,
establishment or business, of the actual or threatened presence or Release in
or into the Environment, or the use, disposal or handling of Hazardous Material
on, at, under or near the Real Property, facility, establishment or business to
be sold, leased, mortgaged, assigned or transferred.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Guaranteed Obligations</b>&#148;
shall have the meaning assigned to such term in <u>Section&nbsp;7.01</u>.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">17</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='17',FILE='C:\fc\7303751694_H10359_1860114\5447-2-ko-07.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 14 00:37 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Guarantees</b>&#148;
shall mean the guarantees issued pursuant to <u>Article&nbsp;VII</u> by the Subsidiary
Guarantors.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Guarantors</b>&#148;
shall mean the Subsidiary Guarantors.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Hazardous Materials</b>&#148;
shall mean the following:&#160; hazardous
substances; hazardous wastes; polychlorinated biphenyls (&#147;<b>PCBs</b>&#148;)
or any substance or compound containing PCBs; asbestos or any
asbestos-containing materials in any form or condition; radon or any other
radioactive materials including any source, special nuclear or by-product
material; petroleum, crude oil or any fraction thereof; and any other pollutant
or contaminant or chemicals, wastes, materials, compounds, constituents or substances,
subject to regulation or which can give rise to liability under any Environmental
Laws.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Hedging Agreement</b>&#148;
shall mean any swap, cap, collar, forward purchase or similar agreements or arrangements
dealing with interest rates, currency exchange rates or commodity prices,
either generally or under specific contingencies.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Hedging Obligations</b>&#148;
shall mean obligations under or with respect to Hedging Agreements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Increase Effective Date</b>&#148;
shall have the meaning assigned to such term in <u>Section 2.20(a)</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Increase Joinder</b>&#148;
shall have the meaning assigned to such term in <u>Section 2.20(c)</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Incremental Term Loan</b>&#148;
shall have the meaning assigned to such term in <u>Section 2.20(c)(i)</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Incremental Term Loan
Commitment</b>&#148; shall have the meaning assigned to such term in <u>Section
2.20(a)</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Incremental Term Loan
Maturity Date</b>&#148; shall have the meaning assigned to such term in <u>Section
2.20(c)(iii)</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Indebtedness</b>&#148;
of any person shall mean, without duplication, (a)&nbsp;all obligations of such
person for borrowed money or advances; (b)&nbsp;all obligations of such person
evidenced by bonds, debentures, notes or similar instruments; (c)&nbsp;all
obligations of such person upon which interest charges are customarily paid or
accrued; (d)&nbsp;all obligations of such person under conditional sale or other
title retention agreements relating to property purchased by such person;
(e)&nbsp;all obligations of such person issued or assumed as the deferred
purchase price of property or services (excluding trade accounts payable and accrued
obligations incurred in the ordinary course of business on normal trade terms
and not overdue by more than 90&nbsp;days or being contested in good faith);
(f)&nbsp;all Indebtedness of others secured by any Lien on property owned or
acquired by such person, whether or not the obligations secured thereby have
been assumed, but limited to the fair market value of such property;
(g)&nbsp;all Capital Lease Obligations, Purchase Money Obligations and
synthetic lease obligations of such person; (h)&nbsp;all Hedging Obligations to
the extent required to be reflected on a balance sheet of such person;
(i)&nbsp;all obligations of such person for the reimbursement of any obligor in
respect of letters of credit, letters of guaranty, bankers&#146; acceptances and
similar credit transactions; and (j)&nbsp;all Contingent Obligations of such
person in respect of Indebtedness or obligations of others of the kinds
referred to in clauses&nbsp;(a) through (i) above.&#160; The Indebtedness of any person shall include
the Indebtedness of any other entity (including any partnership in which such
person is a general partner) to the extent such person is liable therefor as a
result of such person&#146;s ownership </font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">18</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='18',FILE='C:\fc\7303751694_H10359_1860114\5447-2-ko-07.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 14 00:37 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">interest in or other relationship with such entity,
except to the extent that terms of such Indebtedness expressly provide that
such person is not liable therefor.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Indemnified Taxes</b>&#148;
shall mean all Taxes other than Excluded Taxes.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Indemnitee</b>&#148;
shall have the meaning assigned to such term in <u>Section&nbsp;10.03(b)</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Information</b>&#148;
shall have the meaning assigned to such term in <u>Section&nbsp;10.12</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Insurance Policies</b>&#148;
shall mean the insurance policies and coverages required to be maintained by
each Loan Party which is an owner of Mortgaged Property with respect to the
applicable Mortgaged Property pursuant to <u>Section&nbsp;5.04</u> and all
renewals and extensions thereof.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Insurance Requirements</b>&#148;
shall mean, collectively, all provisions of the Insurance Policies, all requirements
of the issuer of any of the Insurance Policies and all orders, rules,
regulations and any other requirements of the National Board of Fire Underwriters
(or any other body exercising similar functions) binding upon each Loan Party
which is an owner of Mortgaged Property and applicable to the Mortgaged
Property or any use or condition thereof.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Intellectual Property</b>&#148;
shall have the meaning assigned to such term in <u>Section&nbsp;3.06(a)</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Intercompany Note</b>&#148;
shall mean a promissory note substantially in the form of <u>Exhibit&nbsp;G</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Interest Election Request</b>&#148;
shall mean a request by Borrower to convert or continue a Revolving Borrowing
or Term Borrowing in accordance with <u>Section&nbsp;2.08(b)</u>, substantially
in the form of <u>Exhibit&nbsp;E</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Interest Payment Date</b>&#148;
shall mean (a)&nbsp;with respect to any ABR Loan (including Swingline Loans),
the last Business Day of each March, June, September and December to occur
during any period in which such Loan is outstanding, (b)&nbsp;with respect to
any Eurodollar Loan, the last day of the Interest Period applicable to the
Borrowing of which such Loan is a part and, in the case of a Eurodollar Loan
with an Interest Period of more than three months&#146; duration, each day prior to
the last day of such Interest Period that occurs at intervals of three months&#146;
duration after the first day of such Interest Period, (c)&nbsp;with respect to
any Revolving Loan or Swingline Loan, the Revolving Maturity Date or such
earlier date on which the Revolving Commitments are terminated and
(d)&nbsp;with respect to any Term Loan, the Term Loan Maturity Date or an Incremental
Term Loan Maturity Date, as the case may be.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Interest Period</b>&#148;
shall mean, with respect to any Eurodollar Borrowing, the period commencing on
the date of such Borrowing and ending on the numerically corresponding day in
the calendar month that is one, two, three or six months (or, if each affected
Lender so agrees, nine months) thereafter, as Borrower may elect; <i>provided</i> that (a)&nbsp;if any Interest Period would end on a
day other than a Business Day, such Interest Period shall be extended to the
next succeeding Business Day unless such next succeeding Business Day would
fall in the next calendar month, in which case such Interest Period shall end
on the next preceding Business Day, and (b)&nbsp;any Interest Period that
commences on the last Business Day of a calendar month (or on a day for which
there is no numerically corresponding day in the last calendar month of such
Interest Period) shall end on the last Business Day of the last calendar month
of such Interest Period.&#160; For purposes
hereof, the date of a Borrowing initially shall be the date on which such
Borrowing is made and thereafter shall be the effective date of the most recent
conversion or continuation of such Borrowing.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">19</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Investments</b>&#148;
shall have the meaning assigned to such term in <u>Section&nbsp;6.04</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Issuing Bank</b>&#148;
shall mean, as the context may require, (a)&nbsp;UBS AG, Stamford Branch, in
its capacity as issuer of Letters of Credit issued by it; (b)&nbsp;any other
Lender that may become an Issuing Bank pursuant to <u>Sections&nbsp;2.18(j)</u>
and <u>(k)</u> in its capacity as issuer of Letters of Credit issued by such
Lender; or (c)&nbsp;collectively, all of the foregoing.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Joinder Agreement</b>&#148;
shall mean a joinder agreement substantially in the form of <u>Exhibit&nbsp;F</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Judgment Currency</b>&#148;
shall have the meaning assigned to such term in <u>Section&nbsp;10.18(a)</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Judgment Currency
Conversion Date</b>&#148; shall have the meaning assigned to such term in <u>Section&nbsp;10.18(a)</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Landlord Access Agreement</b>&#148;
shall mean a Landlord Access Agreement, which shall be in a form as may
reasonably be acceptable to the Administrative Agent.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>LC Participation Fee</b>&#148;
shall have the meaning assigned to such term in <u>Section&nbsp;2.05(c)</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>LC Request</b>&#148; shall
mean a request by Borrower in accordance with the terms of <u>Section&nbsp;2.18(b)</u>
and substantially in the form of <u>Exhibit&nbsp;H</u>, or such other form as
shall be approved by the Administrative Agent.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Leases</b>&#148; shall
mean any and all leases, subleases, tenancies, options, concession agreements,
rental agreements, occupancy agreements, franchise agreements, access
agreements and any other agreements (including all amendments, extensions,
replacements, renewals, modifications and/or guarantees thereof), whether or
not of record and whether now in existence or hereafter entered into, affecting
the use or occupancy of all or any portion of any Real Property.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Lender Addendum</b>&#148;
shall mean with respect to any Lender on the Closing Date, a lender addendum in
the form of <u>Exhibit&nbsp;I</u>, to be executed and delivered by such Lender
on the Closing Date as provided in <u>Section&nbsp;10.15</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Lenders</b>&#148; shall
mean (a)&nbsp;the financial institutions that have become a party hereto pursuant
to a Lender Addendum and (b)&nbsp;any financial institution that has become a
party hereto pursuant to an Assignment and Assumption, other than, in each
case, any such financial institution that has ceased to be a party hereto
pursuant to an Assignment and Assumption.&#160;
Unless the context clearly indicates otherwise, the term &#147;Lenders&#148; shall
include the Swingline Lender.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Letter of Credit</b>&#148;
shall mean any (i)&nbsp;Revolving Letter of Credit, (ii)&nbsp;Commercial Letter
of Credit and (iii)&nbsp;Synthetic Letter of Credit, in each case, issued or to
be issued by an Issuing Bank or the Synthetic LC Issuing Bank, as applicable,
for the account of Borrower pursuant to <u>Section&nbsp;2.18</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:12.0pt 0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Letter of
Credit Expiration Date</b>&#148; shall mean the date (a)&nbsp;which is five
Business Days prior to the Revolving Maturity Date, with respect to a Revolving
Letter of Credit or (b) the Synthetic LC Maturity Date, with respect to the
Synthetic Letters of Credit.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>LIBOR Rate</b>&#148;
shall mean, with respect to any Eurodollar Borrowing for any Interest Period,
the rate per annum determined by the Administrative Agent to be the arithmetic
mean (see &#147;Adjusted</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">20</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='20',FILE='C:\fc\7303751694_H10359_1860114\5447-2-ko-07.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 14 00:37 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">LIBOR Rate&#148;) of the offered rates for deposits in
dollars with a term comparable to such Interest Period that appears on the
Telerate British Bankers Assoc. Interest Settlement Rates Page (as defined below)
at approximately 11:00&nbsp;a.m., London, England time, on the second full
Business Day preceding the first day of such Interest Period; <i>provided</i>,<i> however</i>, that
(i)&nbsp;if no comparable term for an Interest Period is available, the LIBOR
Rate shall be determined using the weighted average of the offered rates for
the two terms most nearly corresponding to such Interest Period and
(ii)&nbsp;if there shall at any time no longer exist a Telerate British Bankers
Assoc. Interest Settlement Rates Page, &#147;LIBOR Rate&#148; shall mean, with respect to
each day during each Interest Period pertaining to Eurodollar Borrowings
comprising part of the same Borrowing, the rate per annum equal to the rate at
which the Administrative Agent is offered deposits in dollars at approximately
11:00&nbsp;a.m., London, England time, two Business Days prior to the first day
of such Interest Period in the London interbank market for delivery on the
first day of such Interest Period for the number of days comprised therein and
in an amount comparable to its portion of the amount of such Eurodollar
Borrowing to be outstanding during such Interest Period.&#160; &#147;<b>Telerate British Bankers
Assoc. Interest Settlement Rates Page</b>&#148; shall mean the display
designated as Page&nbsp;3750 on the Telerate System Incorporated Service (or
such other page as may replace such page on such service for the purpose of
displaying the rates at which dollar deposits are offered by leading banks in
the London interbank deposit market).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Lien</b>&#148; shall
mean, with respect to any property, (a)&nbsp;any mortgage, deed of trust, lien,
pledge, encumbrance, claim, charge, assignment, hypothecation, security
interest or encumbrance of any kind or any arrangement to provide priority or
preference or any filing of any financing statement under the UCC or any other
similar notice of lien under any similar notice or recording statute of any
Governmental Authority, including any easement, right-of-way or other
encumbrance on title to Real Property, in each of the foregoing cases whether
voluntary or imposed by law, and any agreement to give any of the foregoing;
(b)&nbsp;the interest of a vendor or a lessor under any conditional sale
agreement, capital lease or title retention agreement (or any financing lease
having substantially the same economic effect as any of the foregoing) relating
to such property; and (c)&nbsp;in the case of securities, any purchase option,
call or similar right of a third party with respect to such securities.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Loan Documents</b>&#148;
shall mean this Agreement, the Letters of Credit, the Notes (if any) and the
Security Documents.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Loan Parties</b>&#148;
shall mean Borrower and the Subsidiary Guarantors.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Loans</b>&#148; shall
mean, as the context may require, a Revolving Loan, a Term Loan or a Swingline
Loan (and shall include any Replacement Term Loans and any Loans contemplated
by <u>Section 2.20</u>).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Margin Stock</b>&#148;
shall have the meaning assigned to such term in Regulation U.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Material Adverse Effect</b>&#148;
shall mean (a)&nbsp;a material adverse effect on the business, property,
results of operations or condition, financial or otherwise, of Borrower and its
Subsidiaries, taken as a whole; (b)&nbsp;material impairment of the ability of
the Loan Parties to fully and timely perform any of their obligations under the
Loan Documents; (c)&nbsp;material impairment of the rights of or benefits or
remedies available to the Lenders or the Collateral Agent under the Loan
Documents; or (d)&nbsp;a material adverse effect on the Collateral or the Liens
in favor of the Collateral Agent (for its benefit and for the benefit of the
other Secured Parties) on the Collateral or the priority of such Liens.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">21</font></p>
</div><br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='21',FILE='C:\fc\7303751694_H10359_1860114\5447-2-ko-07.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 14 00:37 2007' -->



<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">
<div>


<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Material Indebtedness</b>&#148;
shall mean&nbsp;any Indebtedness (other than the Loans and Letters of Credit)
or Hedging Obligations of Borrower or any of its Subsidiaries in an aggregate
outstanding principal amount exceeding $5.0 million.&#160; For purposes of determining Material
Indebtedness, the &#147;principal amount&#148; in respect of any Hedging Obligations of
any Loan Party at any time shall be the maximum aggregate amount (giving effect
to any netting agreements) that such Loan Party would be required to pay if the
related Hedging Agreement were terminated at such time.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Maximum Rate</b>&#148;
shall have the meaning assigned to such term in <u>Section&nbsp;10.14</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Mortgage</b>&#148; shall
mean an agreement, including, but not limited to, a mortgage, deed of trust or
any other document, creating and evidencing a Lien on a Mortgaged Property,
which shall be in a form reasonably satisfactory to the Collateral Agent, with
such schedules and including such provisions as shall be necessary to conform
such document to applicable local or foreign law or as shall be customary under
applicable local or foreign law.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Mortgaged Property</b>&#148;
shall mean each Real Property, if any, which shall be subject to a Mortgage
delivered after the Closing Date pursuant to <u>Section&nbsp;5.11(c)</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Multiemployer Plan</b>&#148;
shall mean a multiemployer plan within the meaning of Section&nbsp;4001(a)(3)
or Section&nbsp;3(37) of ERISA (a)&nbsp;to which any Company or any ERISA
Affiliate is then making or accruing an obligation to make contributions;
(b)&nbsp;to which any Company or any ERISA Affiliate has within the preceding
five plan years made contributions; or (c)&nbsp;with respect to which any Company
could incur liability.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Net Cash Proceeds</b>&#148;
shall mean:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(a)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; with
respect to any Asset Sale (other than any issuance or sale of Equity Interests),
the cash proceeds received by Borrower or any of its Subsidiaries (including
cash proceeds subsequently received (as and when received by Borrower or any of
its Subsidiaries) in respect of non-cash consideration initially received) net
of (i)&nbsp;selling expenses (including reasonable brokers&#146; fees or
commissions, legal, accounting and other professional and transactional fees,
transfer and similar taxes and Borrower&#146;s good faith estimate of income taxes
paid or payable in connection with such sale); (ii)&nbsp;amounts provided as a
reserve, in accordance with GAAP or as otherwise required pursuant to the
documentation with respect to such Asset Sale, against (x)&nbsp;any liabilities
under any indemnification obligations associated with such Asset Sale or
(y)&nbsp;any other liabilities retained by Borrower or any of its Subsidiaries
associated with the properties sold in such Asset Sale (<i>provided</i>
that, to the extent and at the time any such amounts are released from such
reserve, such amounts shall constitute Net Cash Proceeds); (iii)&nbsp;Borrower&#146;s
good faith estimate of payments required to be made with respect to unassumed
liabilities relating to the properties sold (or the property of any Subsidiary
sold) within 90&nbsp;days of such Asset Sale (<i>provided</i>
that, to the extent such cash proceeds are not used to make payments in respect
of such unassumed liabilities within 90&nbsp;days of such Asset Sale, such cash
proceeds shall constitute Net Cash Proceeds); and (iv)&nbsp;the principal
amount, premium or penalty, if any, interest and other amounts on any Indebtedness
for borrowed money which is secured by a Lien on the properties sold in such
Asset Sale (so long as such Lien was permitted to encumber such properties
under the Loan Documents at the time of such sale) and which is repaid with
such proceeds (other than any such Indebtedness assumed by the purchaser of
such properties);</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">22</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='22',FILE='C:\fc\72194246679_D11156_1858362\5447-2-ko-09.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 13 19:42 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(b)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; with
respect to any Debt Issuance or any issuance or sale of Equity Interests by
Borrower or any of its Subsidiaries, the cash proceeds thereof, net of
customary fees, commissions, costs and other expenses incurred in connection
therewith; and</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(c)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; with
respect to any Casualty Event, the cash insurance proceeds, condemnation awards
and other compensation received in respect thereof, net of all reasonable costs
and expenses incurred in connection with the collection of such proceeds,
awards or other compensation in respect of such Casualty Event (including
Borrower&#146;s good faith estimate of income taxes paid or payable in connection
with such Casualty Event).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Net Working Capital</b>&#148;
shall mean, at any time, Consolidated Current Assets at such time minus Consolidated
Current Liabilities at such time.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Notes</b>&#148; shall
mean any notes evidencing the Term Loans, Revolving Loans or Swingline Loans
issued pursuant to this Agreement, if any, substantially in the form of <u>Exhibit&nbsp;K-1</u>,
<u>K-2</u> or <u>K-3</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Obligation Currency</b>&#148;
shall have the meaning assigned to such term in <u>Section&nbsp;10.18(a)</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Obligations</b>&#148;
shall mean (a)&nbsp;obligations of Borrower and the other Loan Parties from
time to time arising under or in respect of the due and punctual payment of
(i)&nbsp;the principal of and premium, if any, and interest (including interest
accruing during the pendency of any bankruptcy, insolvency, receivership or
other similar proceeding, regardless of whether allowed or allowable in such proceeding)
on the Loans, when and as due, whether at maturity, by acceleration, upon one
or more dates set for prepayment or otherwise, (ii)&nbsp;each payment required
to be made by Borrower and the other Loan Parties under this Agreement in
respect of any Letter of Credit, when and as due, including payments in respect
of Reimbursement Obligations, interest thereon and obligations to provide cash
collateral and (iii)&nbsp;all other monetary obligations, including fees,
costs, expenses and indemnities, whether primary, secondary, direct,
contingent, fixed or otherwise (including monetary obligations incurred during
the pendency of any bankruptcy, insolvency, receivership or other similar
proceeding, regardless of whether allowed or allowable in such proceeding), of
Borrower and the other Loan Parties under this Agreement and the other Loan
Documents, and (b)&nbsp;the due and punctual performance of all covenants,
agreements, obligations and liabilities of Borrower and the other Loan Parties
under or pursuant to this Agreement and the other Loan Documents.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>OFAC</b>&#148; shall
have the meaning assigned to such term in <u>Section&nbsp;3.22</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Officers&#146; Certificate</b>&#148;
shall mean a certificate executed by the chairman of the Board of Directors (if
an officer), the chief executive officer or the president and one of the
Financial Officers, each in his or her official (and not individual) capacity.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Organizational Documents</b>&#148;
shall mean, with respect to any person, (i)&nbsp;in the case of any corporation,
the certificate of incorporation and by-laws (or similar documents) of such
person, (ii)&nbsp;in the case of any limited liability company, the certificate
of formation and operating agreement (or similar documents) of such person,
(iii)&nbsp;in the case of any limited partnership, the certificate of formation
and limited partnership agreement (or similar documents) of such person,
(iv)&nbsp;in the case of any general partnership, the partnership agreement (or
similar document) of such person and (v)&nbsp;in any other case, the functional
equivalent of the foregoing.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">23</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='23',FILE='C:\fc\72194246679_D11156_1858362\5447-2-ko-09.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 13 19:42 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Other Taxes</b>&#148;
shall mean all present or future stamp or documentary taxes or any other excise
or property taxes, charges or similar levies arising from any payment made hereunder
or under any other Loan Document or from the execution, delivery or enforcement
of, or otherwise with respect to, this Agreement or any other Loan Document.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Oxford</b>&#148; shall
have the meaning assigned to such term in the first recital hereto.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Oxford Stockholders</b>&#148;
shall mean the stockholders of Oxford prior to the Closing Date.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Participant</b>&#148;
shall have the meaning assigned to such term in <u>Section&nbsp;10.04(d)</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Participating Member
States</b>&#148; shall mean the member states of the European Communities
that adopt or have adopted the euro as their lawful currency in accordance with
the legislation of the European Union relating to European Monetary Union.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>PBGC</b>&#148; shall
mean the Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation referred to and defined in ERISA.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Perfection Certificate</b>&#148;
shall mean a certificate in the form of <u>Exhibit&nbsp;L-1</u> or any other
form reasonably approved by the Collateral Agent, as the same shall be
supplemented from time to time by a Perfection Certificate Supplement or
otherwise.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Perfection Certificate
Supplement</b>&#148; shall mean a certificate supplement in the form of <u>Exhibit&nbsp;L-2</u>
or any other form reasonably approved by the Collateral Agent.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Permitted Acquisition</b>&#148;
shall mean any transaction or series of related transactions for the direct or
indirect (a)&nbsp;acquisition of all or substantially all of the property of
any person, or of any business or division of any person; (b)&nbsp;acquisition
of in excess of 50% of the Equity Interests of any person who is or becomes a
Loan Party or a Subsidiary of a Loan Party after giving effect thereto; or
(c)&nbsp;merger or consolidation or any other combination with any person, if
each of the following conditions is met:</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(i)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; no Default then exists or would
result therefrom;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(ii)&#160; &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; after
giving effect to such transaction on a Pro Forma Basis, (A)&nbsp;Borrower shall
be in compliance with all covenants set forth in Sections&nbsp;6.10 (a) and (b)
as of the most recent Test Period (assuming (x) for purposes of Section&nbsp;6.10,
that such transaction, and all other Permitted Acquisitions consummated since
the first day of the relevant Test Period for each of the financial covenants
set forth in Section&nbsp;6.10 ending on or prior to the date of such
transaction, had occurred on the first day of such relevant Test Period and (y)
if such transaction is to be consummated prior to the last day of the first
Test Period for which the covenants in Sections&nbsp;6.10 (a), (b), and (c) are
required to be satisfied, the levels required for such first Test Period shall
be deemed to apply in determining compliance with such covenants for purposes
of this clause (A)), and (B)&nbsp;unless expressly approved by the
Administrative Agent, the person or business to be acquired shall have
generated positive cash flow for the Test Period most recently ended prior to
the date of consummation of such acquisition;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(iii) &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; no
Company shall, in connection with any such transaction, assume or remain liable
with respect to any Indebtedness or other liability (including any material tax
or ERISA liability) of the related seller or the business, person or properties
acquired, except (A)&nbsp;to the extent permitted under <u>Section&nbsp;6.01</u>
and (B)&nbsp;obligations not constituting Indebtedness incurred in the </font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">24</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='24',FILE='C:\fc\72194246679_D11156_1858362\5447-2-ko-09.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 13 19:42 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">ordinary course of
business and necessary or desirable to the continued operation of the
underlying properties, and any other such liabilities or obligations not
permitted to be assumed or otherwise supported by any Company hereunder shall
be paid in full or released as to the business, persons or properties being so
acquired on or before the consummation of such acquisition;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(iv)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; the person or business to be acquired
shall be, or shall be engaged in, a business of the type that Borrower and the
Subsidiaries are permitted to be engaged in under Section&nbsp;6.15 and, to the
extent required pursuant to this Agreement, the property acquired in connection
with any such transaction shall be made subject to the Lien of the Security
Documents and shall be free and clear of any Liens, other than Permitted Liens;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(v) &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; the
Board of Directors of the person to be acquired shall not have indicated publicly
its opposition to the consummation of such acquisition (which opposition has
not been publicly withdrawn);</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(vi)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; all transactions in connection
therewith shall be consummated in accordance in all material respects with all
applicable Requirements of Law;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(vii)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; with respect to any transaction
involving Acquisition Consideration of more than $10.0 million, unless the
Administrative Agent shall otherwise agree, Borrower shall have provided the
Administrative Agent and the Lenders with (A)&nbsp;historical financial
statements for the last three fiscal years (or, if less, the number of years
since formation) of the person or business to be acquired (audited if
available) and unaudited financial statements thereof for the most recent
quarter which are available, (B)&nbsp;reasonably detailed projections for the
succeeding five years pertaining to the person or business to be acquired and
updated projections for Borrower after giving effect to such transaction,
(C)&nbsp;a reasonably detailed description of all material information relating
thereto and copies of all material documentation pertaining to such
transaction, and (D)&nbsp;all such other information and data relating to such
transaction or the person or business to be acquired as may be reasonably
requested by the Administrative Agent or the Required Lenders;</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(viii)&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; at least 10 Business Days prior to the
proposed date of consummation of the transaction, Borrower shall have delivered
to the Agents and the Lenders an Officers&#146; Certificate certifying that
(A)&nbsp;such transaction complies with this definition (which, for
transactions for a consideration in excess of $2.0 million, shall have attached
thereto reasonably detailed backup data and calculations showing such
compliance), and (B)&nbsp;such transaction could not reasonably be expected to
result in a Material Adverse Effect; and</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt 36.0pt;page-break-after:auto;text-indent:36.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">(ix) &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; the
Acquisition Consideration for such acquisition (excluding any such Acquisition
Consideration paid in the form of common stock of Borrower) shall not exceed
$25.0&nbsp;million, and the aggregate amount of the Acquisition Consideration
for all Permitted Acquisitions since the Closing Date (excluding any such
Acquisition Consideration paid in the form of common stock of Borrower) shall
not exceed $75.0&nbsp;million; provided that any Equity Interests constituting
all or a portion of such Acquisition Consideration shall not have a cash
dividend requirement on or prior to the Final Maturity Date.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Permitted Liens</b>&#148;
shall have the meaning assigned to such term in <u>Section&nbsp;6.02</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>person</b>&#148; shall
mean any natural person, corporation, limited liability company, trust, joint
venture, association, company, partnership, Governmental Authority or other
entity.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">25</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='25',FILE='C:\fc\72194246679_D11156_1858362\5447-2-ko-09.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 13 19:42 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Plan</b>&#148; shall
mean any employee pension benefit plan (other than a Multiemployer Plan)
subject to the provisions of Title IV of ERISA or Section&nbsp;412 of the Code
or Section&nbsp;302 of ERISA which is maintained or contributed to by any
Company or its ERISA Affiliate or with respect to which any Company could incur
liability (including under Section&nbsp;4069 of ERISA).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Platform</b>&#148; shall
have the meaning assigned to such term in <u>Section&nbsp;10.01(d)</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Preferred Stock</b>&#148;
shall mean, with respect to any person, any and all preferred or preference
Equity Interests (however designated) of such person whether now outstanding or
issued after the Closing Date.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Preferred Stock Issuance</b>&#148;
shall mean the issuance or sale by Borrower or any of its Subsidiaries of any
Preferred Stock after the Closing Date (other than as permitted by <u>Section&nbsp;6.01</u>).</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Premises</b>&#148; shall
have the meaning assigned thereto in the applicable Mortgage.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Pro Forma Basis</b>&#148;
shall mean on a basis in accordance with GAAP and Regulation S-X and otherwise
reasonably satisfactory to the Administrative Agent.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Pro Rata Percentage</b>&#148;
of any Revolving Lender at any time shall mean the percentage of the total
Revolving Commitments of all Revolving Lenders represented by such Lender&#146;s
Revolving Commitment.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>property</b>&#148; shall
mean any right, title or interest in or to property or assets of any kind
whatsoever, whether real, personal or mixed and whether tangible or intangible
and including Equity Interests or other ownership interests of any person and
whether now in existence or owned or hereafter entered into or acquired, including
all Real Property.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Purchase Money Obligation</b>&#148;
shall mean, for any person, the obligations of such person in respect of
Indebtedness (including Capital Lease Obligations) incurred for the purpose of
financing all or any part of the purchase price of any property (including
Equity Interests of any person) or the cost of installation, construction or
improvement of any property and any refinancing thereof; <i>provided</i>,<i> however</i>, that (i) such Indebtedness is incurred within one
year after such acquisition, installation, construction or improvement of such
property by such person and (ii) the amount of such Indebtedness does not
exceed 100% of the cost of such acquisition, installation, construction or
improvement, as the case may be.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Qualified Capital Stock</b>&#148;
of any person shall mean any Equity Interests of such person that are not Disqualified
Capital Stock.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Real Property</b>&#148;
shall mean, collectively, all right, title and interest (including any
leasehold, mineral or other estate) in and to any and all parcels of or
interests in real property owned, leased or operated by any person, whether by
lease, license or other means, together with, in each case, all easements,
hereditaments and appurtenances relating thereto, all improvements and
appurtenant fixtures and equipment, all general intangibles and contract rights
and other property and rights incidental to the ownership, lease or operation
thereof.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Refinancing</b>&#148;
shall mean the repayment in full and the termination of any commitment to make
extensions of credit under all of the outstanding indebtedness listed on <u>Schedule&nbsp;1.01(a)</u>
of Borrower or any of its Subsidiaries.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">26</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='26',FILE='C:\fc\72194246679_D11156_1858362\5447-2-ko-09.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 13 19:42 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Register</b>&#148; shall
have the meaning assigned to such term in <u>Section&nbsp;10.04(c)</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Regulation D</b>&#148;
shall mean Regulation D of the Board as from time to time in effect and all
official rulings and interpretations thereunder or thereof.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Regulation S-X</b>&#148;
shall mean Regulation S-X promulgated under the Securities Act.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Regulation T</b>&#148;
shall mean Regulation T of the Board as from time to time in effect and all
official rulings and interpretations thereunder or thereof.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Regulation U</b>&#148;
shall mean Regulation U of the Board as from time to time in effect and all official
rulings and interpretations thereunder or thereof.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Regulation X</b>&#148;
shall mean Regulation X of the Board as from time to time in effect and all
official rulings and interpretations thereunder or thereof.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Reimbursement Obligations</b>&#148;
shall mean Borrower&#146;s obligations under <u>Section&nbsp;2.18(e)</u> to reimburse
LC Disbursements.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Related Parties</b>&#148;
shall mean, with respect to any person, such person&#146;s Affiliates and the
partners, directors, officers, employees, agents and advisors of such person
and of such person&#146;s Affiliates.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Release</b>&#148; shall
mean any spilling, leaking, seepage, pumping, pouring, emitting, emptying, discharging,
injecting, escaping, leaching, dumping, disposing, depositing, dispersing,
emanating or migrating of any Hazardous Material in, into, onto or through the
Environment.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Relevant Currency
Equivalent</b>&#148; shall mean the Dollar Equivalent or each Alternate
Currency Equivalent, as applicable.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Replacement Term Loan</b>&#148;
shall have the meaning assigned to such term in <u>Section&nbsp;10.02(e)</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Required Class Lenders</b>&#148;
shall mean (i) with respect to Term Loans, Lenders having more than 50% of all
Term Loans outstanding and (ii) with respect to Revolving Loans, Required Revolving
Lenders.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Required Lenders</b>&#148;
shall mean Lenders having more than 50% of the sum of the principal amount of
all Loans outstanding, LC Exposure and unused Revolving and Term Loan Commitments.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Required Revolving Lenders</b>&#148;
shall mean Lenders having more than 50% of all Revolving Commitments or, after
the Revolving Commitments have terminated, more than 50% of all Revolving Exposure.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Requirements of Law</b>&#148;
shall mean, collectively, any and all requirements of any Governmental Authority
including any and all laws, judgments, orders, decrees, ordinances, rules,
regulations, statutes or case law.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">27</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='27',FILE='C:\fc\72194246679_D11156_1858362\5447-2-ko-09.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 13 19:42 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Response</b>&#148; shall
mean (a) &#147;response&#148; as such term is defined in CERCLA, 42 U.S.C.
&#167;&nbsp;9601(24), and (b)&nbsp;all other actions required by any Governmental
Authority or voluntarily undertaken to (i)&nbsp;clean up, remove, treat, abate
or in any other way address any Hazardous Material in the Environment;
(ii)&nbsp;prevent the Release or threat of Release, or minimize the further
Release, of any Hazardous Material; or (iii)&nbsp;perform studies and
investigations in connection with, or as a precondition to, or to determine the
necessity of the activities described in, clause&nbsp;(i) or (ii) above.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Responsible Officer</b>&#148;
of any person shall mean any executive officer or Financial Officer of such
person and any other officer or similar official thereof with responsibility
for the administration of the obligations of such person in respect of this
Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Revolving Availability
Period</b>&#148; shall mean the period from and including the Closing Date to
but excluding the earlier of (i)&nbsp;the Business Day preceding the Revolving
Maturity Date and (ii)&nbsp;the date of termination of the Revolving
Commitments.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Revolving Borrowing</b>&#148;
shall mean a Borrowing comprised of Revolving Loans.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Revolving Commitment</b>&#148;
shall mean, with respect to each Lender, the commitment, if any, of such Lender
to make Revolving Loans hereunder up to the amount set forth on Schedule&nbsp;I
to the Lender Addendum executed and delivered by such Lender or by an Increase
Joinder, or in the Assignment and Assumption pursuant to which such Lender
assumed its Revolving Commitment, as applicable, as the same may be
(a)&nbsp;reduced from time to time pursuant to <u>Section&nbsp;2.07</u> and
(b)&nbsp;reduced or increased from time to time pursuant to assignments by or
to such Lender pursuant to <u>Section&nbsp;10.04</u>.&#160; The aggregate amount of the Lenders&#146;
Revolving Commitments on the Closing Date is $20.0 million.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Revolving Exposure</b>&#148;
shall mean, with respect to any Lender at any time, the aggregate principal
amount at such time of all outstanding Revolving Loans of such Lender, <i>plus</i> the aggregate amount at such time of such Lender&#146;s
Revolving LC Exposure, <i>plus</i> the
aggregate amount at such time of such Lender&#146;s Swingline Exposure.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Revolving LC Commitment</b>&#148;
shall mean the commitment of the Issuing Bank to issue Revolving Letters of
Credit pursuant to <u>Section&nbsp;2.18</u>.&#160;
The amount of the Revolving LC Commitment shall initially be $10.0
million, but in no event exceed the aggregate Revolving Commitments.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Revolving LC Disbursement</b>&#148;
shall mean a payment or disbursement made by the Issuing Bank pursuant to a
drawing under a Revolving Letter of Credit.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Revolving LC Exposure</b>&#148;
shall mean at any time the sum of (a)&nbsp;the aggregate undrawn amount of all
outstanding Revolving Letters of Credit at such time <i>plus</i>
(b)&nbsp;the aggregate principal amount of all Reimbursement Obligations with
respect to Revolving Letters of Credit outstanding at such time.&#160; The Revolving LC Exposure of any Revolving
Lender at any time shall mean its Pro Rata Percentage of the aggregate
Revolving LC Exposure at such time.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Revolving Lender</b>&#148;
shall mean a Lender with a Revolving Commitment.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Revolving Letter of Credit</b>&#148;
means, at any time, a Standby Letter of Credit or Commercial Letter of Credit
issued by an Issuing Bank pursuant to <u>Section 2.18</u>.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">28</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='28',FILE='C:\fc\72194246679_D11156_1858362\5447-2-ko-09.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 13 19:42 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Revolving Loan</b>&#148;
shall mean a Loan made by the Lenders to Borrower pursuant to <u>Section&nbsp;2.01(b)</u>.&#160; Each Revolving Loan shall either be an ABR
Revolving Loan or a Eurodollar Revolving Loan.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Revolving Maturity Date</b>&#148;
shall mean the date which is five years after the Closing Date or, if such date
is not a Business Day, the first Business Day thereafter.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Sale and Leaseback
Transaction</b>&#148; has the meaning assigned to such term in <u>Section&nbsp;6.03</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Sarbanes-Oxley Act</b>&#148;
shall mean the United States Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, as amended, and all
rules and regulations promulgated thereunder.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Secured Obligations</b>&#148;
shall mean (a) the Obligations, (b) the due and punctual payment and
performance of all obligations of Borrower and the other Loan Parties under
each Hedging Agreement entered into with any counterparty that is a Secured
Party and (c)&nbsp;the due and punctual payment and performance of all
obligations of Borrower and the other Loan Parties (including overdrafts and
related liabilities) under each Treasury Services Agreement entered into with
any counterparty that is a Secured Party.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Secured Parties</b>&#148;
shall mean, collectively, the Administrative Agent, the Collateral Agent, the
Issuing Bank, the Synthetic LC Issuing Bank, each other Agent, the Lenders and
each counterparty to a Hedging Agreement or Treasury Services Agreement if at
the date of entering into such Hedging Agreement or Treasury Services Agreement
such person was a Lender or an Affiliate of a Lender and such person executes
and delivers to the Administrative Agent a letter agreement in form and
substance reasonably acceptable to the Administrative Agent pursuant to which
such person (i)&nbsp;appoints the Collateral Agent as its agent under the
applicable Loan Documents and (ii)&nbsp;agrees to be bound by the provisions of
<u>Sections&nbsp;10.03</u> and <u>10.09</u> as if it were a Lender.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Securities Act</b>&#148;
shall mean the Securities Act of 1933.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Securities Collateral</b>&#148;
shall have the meaning assigned to such term in the Security Agreement.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Security Agreement</b>&#148;
shall mean a Security Agreement substantially in the form of <u>Exhibit&nbsp;M</u>
among the Loan Parties and Collateral Agent for the benefit of the Secured
Parties.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Security Agreement
Collateral</b>&#148; shall mean all property pledged or granted as collateral
pursuant to the Security Agreement (a) on the Closing Date or (b) thereafter
pursuant to <u>Section&nbsp;5.11</u>.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Security Documents</b>&#148;
shall mean the Security Agreement, the Mortgages and each other security document
or pledge agreement delivered in accordance with applicable local or foreign
law to grant a valid, perfected security interest in any property as collateral
for the Secured Obligations, and all UCC or other financing statements or
instruments of perfection required by this Agreement, the Security Agreement,
any Mortgage or any other such security document or pledge agreement to be
filed with respect to the security interests in property and fixtures created
pursuant to the Security Agreement or any Mortgage and any other document or
instrument utilized to pledge or grant or purport to pledge or grant a security
interest or lien on any property as collateral for the Secured Obligations.</font></p>


 <p style="margin:24.0pt 0pt .0001pt;text-align:center;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">29</font></p> <br><hr size="3" width="100%" noshade color="#010101" align="center">

<!-- SEQ.=1,FOLIO='29',FILE='C:\fc\72194246679_D11156_1858362\5447-2-ko-09.htm',USER='jmsproofassembler',CD='Mar 13 19:42 2007' -->
<br clear="all" style="page-break-before:always;">



<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Spot Selling Rate</b>&#148;
shall mean the spot selling rate at which the Administrative Agent offers to
sell such Alternate Currency for dollars in the London foreign exchange market
at approximately 11:00 a.m. London time on such date for delivery two (2) Business
Days later.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Standby Letter of Credit</b>&#148;
shall mean any standby letter of credit or similar instrument issued for the
purpose of supporting (a)&nbsp;workers&#146; compensation liabilities of Borrower or
any of its Subsidiaries, (b)&nbsp;the obligations of third-party insurers of
Borrower or any of its Subsidiaries arising by virtue of the laws of any
jurisdiction requiring third-party insurers to obtain such letters of credit,
(c) performance, payment, deposit or surety obligations of Borrower or any of
its Subsidiaries if required by a Requirement of Law or in accordance with
custom and practice in the industry or (d)&nbsp;any other obligation of
Borrower or any of its Subsidiaries to persons other than Borrower or any of
its Subsidiaries or Affiliates.</font></p>

<p style="margin:0pt 0pt 12.0pt;text-indent:72.0pt;"><font size="2" face="Times New Roman" style="font-size:10.0pt;">&#147;<b>Statutory Reserves</b>&#148;
shall mean, for any Interest Period for any Eurodollar Borrowing, the average
